VAPOR-GitHubPage

GitHub Page specification for NCAR/VAPOR

View on GitHub Download .zip Download .tar.gz

DART has been reformulated to better support the ensemble data assimilation needs of researchers who are interested in native netCDF support, less filesystem I/O, better computational performance, good scaling for large processor counts, and support for the memory requirements of very large models. Manhattan has support for many of our larger models (WRF, POP, CAM, CICE, CLM, ROMS, MPAS_ATM, â€¦) with many more being added as time permits. The hallmarks of DART; tutorials, examples, extensive documentation, introductory materials, and performance diagnostics are maintained in an easier-to-grasp organization:

  1. assimilation_code ( programs and support modules )
  2. build_templates ( hardware/compiler options )
  3. diagnostics
  4. documentation
  5. developer_tests
  6. models
  7. observations ( observation converters and forward operators )
  • Home
  • About Us
  • Code Distributions
